JOGL: The JOGL source code is mostly licensed under the 'New BSD 2-Clause License', however it contains other licensed material as well.
Other licensed material is compatible with the 'New BSD 2-Clause License', if not stated otherwise.
'New BSD 2-Clause License' incompatible materials are optional, they are:
A.7) The JOGL source tree _may_ contain code from Oculus VR, Inc. which is covered by it's own permissive Oculus VR Rift SDK Software License. (Optional, see A.7 below for details)
Below you find a detailed list of licenses used in this project.
+++
The content of folder 'make/lib' contains build- and test-time only Java binaries (JAR) to ease the build setup. Each JAR file has it's corresponding LICENSE file containing the source location and license text. None of these binaries are contained in any way by the generated and deployed JOGL binaries.
+++

<http://code.google.com/p/pngj/>
Author: Hernan J. Gonzalez and Shawn Hartsock

Apache Licenses http://www.apache.org/licenses/

A.7) The JOGL source tree _may_ contain code from Oculus VR, Inc. which is covered by it's own permissive Oculus VR Rift SDK Software License.
This code _can_ be included to produce a binding and hence support for the Oculus VR Rift.
The code is included _and_ it's build artifacts will be released, if the git sub-module oculusvr-sdk is included in the jogl source repository as true for current official JogAmp builds and releases!
If using JogAmp JOGL builds with oculusvr-sdk support, but the user prefers to _not_ use it for license or other reasons, the user can simply remove the artifacts 'jar/atomics/oculusvr*jar'. No other produced artifact is affected.
While the Oculus VR Rift SDK Software License is permissive, it's differences to the New BSD license shall be mentioned, see below!
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
